brief_description: Using the Collaborative Cross, a population of recombinant inbred mouse strains with high levels of standing genetic variation, we have identified a mouse model of persistent WNV disease, with persistence of viral loads within the brain.
brief_title: A Mouse Model of Chronic West Nile Virus
description: Using the Collaborative Cross, a population of recombinant inbred mouse strains with high levels of standing genetic variation, we have identified a mouse model of persistent WNV disease, with persistence of viral loads within the brain.
endpoints: Weight, viral load, qPCR, flow cytometry, microarray gene expression
hypothesis: We hypothesize that a regulatory T cell response sufficiently restrains the immune response such that a chronic infection can be maintained in the CNS.
objectives: Identify a mouse model of chronic WNV infection using the Collaborative Cross, a panel of reproducible recombinant inbred mouse strains with a high degree of standing genetic variation.
official_title: A Mouse Model of Chronic West Nile Virus

pubmed.title: A Mouse Model of Chronic West Nile Virus Disease.

program.program_name: Systems Approach to Immunity and Inflammation RFA-AI-11-017
program.contract_name: Systems Immunogenetics of Biodefense Pathogens in the Collaborative Cross
